sub_title: Team Coordinator and Value Chain Manager at the Ministry of Agriculture, Nature & Food Quality
summary:
Klaas has working experience in socio-economic and agribusiness development in Africa and South East Asia, specialising in food and nutrition security and private sector development. 

Since the start of his career, Klaas has been involved in designing and facilitating initiatives with companies and government institutions to realise sustainable value chains that contribute to improved food security. He as also developed projects and courses for professionals in which there is a focus on linking agriculture development to food & nutrition security to stimulate sustainable development. Furthermore, Klaas has actively supported Dutch embassies and ministries in developing and implementing policies with regard to food & nutrition security and private sector development.

Currently, Klaas lives in Kigali where he is working on SNV's HortInvest project which promotes inclusive development of the Rwandan horticulture sector by partnering with the private sector.

projects.title: HortInvest
projects.description:
The HortInvest project aims to increase farmers’ incomes, grow the relative contribution of the horticultural sector to the regional economy in North West Rwanda, and improve the food and nutrition security of the targeted households. HortInvest will help realise the Rwandan National Horticulture Policy to create fast economic growth, and reduce poverty and malnutrition. The project covers six target districts in North-west Rwanda.

HortInvest has four components, aligned with Rwanda’s National Horticultural Policy:
- Production for domestic and regional markets
- Food & Nutrition security improvement
- Supply chains for export markets
- Strengthening the enabling environment

contributors.headline: Team Coordinator and Value Chain Manager at the Ministry of Agriculture, Nature & Food Quality

projects.title: An expert seminar: The role of the private sector in nutrition security
projects.description:
Role: organisation, coordination, background research.
The expert seminar enabled participants to know how the private sector could play a role in addressing undernutrition in developing countries; what is the potential for the private sector to influence food consumption and nutrition and under what conditions can the private sector contribute to improved nutritional outcomes for the poor. In addition, the seminar enabled participants to identify the existing gaps of evidence. 
Contributions by GAIN, Wageningen UR, DE Masterblenders 1753, GAIN and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (NL).

projects.title: Amsterdam Initiative against Malnutrition (AIM)
projects.description:
Coordination of proposal development of a project in Kenya and Tanzania that covers the vegetable value chain (from seed to mouth) including a component for innovative solar drying of vegetables. Developed in cooperation with Rijk Zwaan BV, Rabobank Foundation, Hivos and the Global Alliance for Improved Nutrition. The proposal is part of the umbrella proposal prepared for the Dutch government's Public-Private Partnership Facility for Sustainable Entrepreneurship and Food Security.

In addition, contributions to overarching AIM program development and other workstreams (e.g. Nutrition Sensitive Value Chains)

contributors.headline: Team Coordinator and Value Chain Manager at the Ministry of Agriculture, Nature & Food Quality

projects.title: Nutrition Security Portal
projects.description:
Role: Setting up the portal in terms of content, content development and collection

This portal is part of a new platform from the Centre for Development Innovation, part of Wageningen University and Research Centre.

The purpose of this platform is to provide practitioners, from all angels of nutrition and food security, access to the latest and most relevant knowledge and a place to share knowledge, experiences and strategies. Participants of the Nutrition and Food Security Training Programme can, beside the course materials, also access other relevant resources.

contributors.headline: Team Coordinator and Value Chain Manager at the Ministry of Agriculture, Nature & Food Quality

projects.title: E-learning course food and nutrition security
projects.description: At the request of the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs, I coordinated and developed an online course on food and nutrition security (FNS). The main target group of this course were policy makers at Dutch ministries and embassies, as well as other professionals who work within the sphere of FNS.

projects.title: Agriculture-Nutrition Linkages Course development
projects.description:
I participated in the development of the Agriculture-Nutrition Linkages course development. Setting up the two week program, chosing themes and doing background research.
The course was for the first time provided in November 2013 in Addis Ababa, with two colleagues as facilitators

contributors.headline: Team Coordinator and Value Chain Manager at the Ministry of Agriculture, Nature & Food Quality

projects.title: Scoping mission Agribusiness incubator/telephone farmers Kenya
projects.description:
Roles: Scoping mission coordination, literature study agribusiness incubator, field study telephone farmers (Rift Valley area, Kenya), writing report, ToR and intervention model.

In an assignment for the Embassy of the Netherlands in Nairobi, I was part of a team of three consultants that completed a scoping mission in Kenya. The Embassy expressed its interest to explore opportunities to increase the contribution of telephone (or absentee) farmers to food security in Kenya. An agribusiness incubator that could improve, amongst others, access to technological support, market linkages and farm management support was the central body to trigger this increased contribution. 
The end product was a report, which included the challenges faced by telephone farmers in Kenya, an analysis of the added value of an agribusinees incubator for telephone farmers, a proposed agribusiness incubator implementation model and a terms of reference for the proposed intervention.

profile_positions.title: Advisor HortInvest

profile_positions.description: As a project advisor at the HortIMPACT program that SNV is implementing for the Netherlands Embassy in Nairobi, Klaas is identifying and facilitating the realisation of business cases that contribute to the development of the Kenyan horticulture sector as well as to food & nutrition security. The program also aims to identify new business opportunities for the Dutch companies that are able to contribute to these objectives.
